verses.verse: I will follow Thee, my Savior, Wheresoe'er my lot may be. Where thou goest I will follow; Yes, my Lord, I'll follow Thee.
Though the road be rough and thorny, Trackless as the foaming sea, Thou hast trod this way before me, And I'll gladly follow Thee.
Though I meet with tribulations, Sorely tempted though I be; I remember Thou wast tempted, And rejoice to follow Thee.
Though Thou leadest me through affliction, Poor, forsaken though I be; Thou wast destitute, afflicted, And I only follow Thee.
Though to Jordan's rolling billows, Cold and deep, Thou leadest me, Thou hast crossed the waves before me, And I still will follow Thee.
